section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a Type A account-holder—the terms and conditions imposed under section 6A for the time being in relation to the account-holder; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a Type B account-holder—the terms and conditions imposed under section 6B for the time being in relation to the account-holder; (25 of 2021 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Type A account-holder; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Type B account-holder; (25 of 2021 s. 12)

section.def: contractor (other than a station operator) (承辦商 (轉運站經營人除外)) means any person, other than a station operator, who has entered into an agreement with the Government or with a station operator for the carrying out of an activity or the provision of a service in connection with the operation or management of a refuse transfer station;
designated officer (指定人員) means a person appointed by the Director under section 14;
gross vehicle weight (車輛總重) and permitted gross vehicle weight (許可車輛總重) have the same meaning as assigned to them under section 2 of the Road Traffic Ordinance (Cap. 374);
non-peak hours (非繁忙時間) means the periods from 7:30 a.m. and up to 8 a.m. and after 9 a.m. and up to 11:30 p.m.;
peak hours (繁忙時間) means the period after 8 a.m. and up to 9 a.m.;
permitted vehicle (獲准車輛), in relation to a scheduled facility, means a vehicle registered as a permitted vehicle for the facility under section 6A or 7A; (25 of 2021 s. 12)
refuse transfer station (廢物轉運站) means a station at which waste is processed for the purpose of transmission for disposal elsewhere;
registered account-holder (登記帳戶戶主) means, in relation to a refuse transfer station, a person registered as a registered account-holder for that refuse transfer station under section 6;
registered owner (登記車主) has the same meaning as assigned to it under section 2 of the Road Traffic Ordinance (Cap. 374);
registered vehicle (登記車輛) means, in relation to a refuse transfer station, a vehicle registered for that refuse transfer station under section 6;
registration mark (登記號碼) has the same meaning as assigned to it under section 2 of the Road Traffic Ordinance (Cap. 374);
scheduled facility (附表設施) means a Group 1 facility, Group 2 facility or Group 3 facility as defined in section 1 of Part 1 of the Schedule; (25 of 2021 s. 12)
service conditions (服務條件) means, in relation to a registered account-holder, the terms and conditions specified for the time being in relation to that registered account-holder under section 6;
station operator (轉運站經營人) means any person who has entered into an agreement with the Government for the operation or management of a refuse transfer station;
unacceptable waste (不予接受的廢物) means any waste specified as such by the Director in service conditions.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application
section.content: This Regulation applies to the refuse transfer stations specified in column 2 of Part 1A of the Schedule and to the disposal of municipal solid waste at a scheduled facility.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Disposal of waste at refuse transfer stations

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not dispose of waste at a refuse transfer station unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is disposed of from a vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registered owner of the vehicle is registered as a registered account-holder for that refuse transfer station; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the vehicle is registered in the name of that account-holder for the refuse transfer station.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to any person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disposing of waste from a vehicle owned by the Government;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: disposing of waste collected by or on behalf of the Director of Food and Environmental Hygiene or the Director of Leisure and Cultural Services. (L.N. 183 of 2000)

section.name: s4A
section.heading: Exemption from section 4 granted on application

subsection.content: Subject to section 4C, the Director may, on application by a person (applicant), exempt any person from section 4(1) for a period that the Director considers appropriate.
An application under subsection (1) must be made in the form specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must, by written notice, inform the applicant of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director’s decision to grant, or refuse to grant, the exemption; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Director refuses to grant the exemption—the reason for the refusal.

subsection.content: An exemption granted under subsection (1) may be subject to any condition specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may revoke an exemption granted under subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the application for the exemption, the applicant provided any information that was false or misleading in a material particular;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any condition specified under subsection (4) for the exemption is contravened; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that there is no longer any justification for the exemption.

subsection.content: If an exemption is revoked under subsection (5), the Director must, by written notice, inform the applicant of the revocation and the reason for it.

section.name: s4B
section.heading: Exemption from section 4 granted on Director’s own initiative

subsection.content: Subject to section 4C, the Director may, on the Director’s own initiative, exempt any person (exempted person) from section 4(1) for a period that the Director considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must inform the exempted person of the Director’s decision to grant the exemption—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by written notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a written notice is impracticable in the circumstances—in a way that the Director considers appropriate.

subsection.content: An exemption granted under subsection (1) may be subject to any condition specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may revoke an exemption granted under subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any condition specified under subsection (3) for the exemption is contravened; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that there is no longer any justification for the exemption.

subsection.leadIn: If an exemption is revoked under subsection (4), the Director must inform the exempted person of the revocation and the reason for it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by written notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a written notice is impracticable in the circumstances—in a way that the Director considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must not grant an exemption under section 4A(1) or 4B(1) unless the Director is satisfied—

subparagraph.content: the exemption is necessary for public safety, environmental hygiene or environmental protection; or

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: it is impracticable for the person to comply with section 4(1); or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: it is unreasonable to expect such compliance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the vehicle from which the person disposes of municipal solid waste is suitable for disposing of municipal solid waste at one or more scheduled facilities.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), a vehicle is suitable for disposing of municipal solid waste at a scheduled facility if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vehicle is in good working condition;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the vehicle is constructed in a way that does not—

subparagraph.content: endanger the safety of any person at the facility;
create any nuisance, or any danger to health or the environment, arising from its activity in the facility; or
disrupt the operation of the facility or any collection, removal, transportation, transfer, reception or disposal (including treatment, reprocessing or recycling) of waste in the facility; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the vehicle is equipped with a device described in section 3B of the Waste Disposal (Designated Waste Disposal Facility) Regulation (Cap. 354 sub. leg. L)—it complies with the requirement in subsection (3) of that section.

subsection.leadIn: A person may make an application to the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be registered as a registered account-holder for the purpose of disposing of waste at refuse transfer stations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to register in his name one or more vehicles of which he is the registered owner to be used for the disposal of waste at refuse transfer stations.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in writing and in a manner and form specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain the particulars, information and supporting materials the Director reasonably requires to enable him to determine the application.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may under subsection (2)(b) require, in particular, the applicant to specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the refuse transfer station or stations at which waste is intended to be disposed of;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the estimated amount of waste that is intended to be disposed of at the refuse transfer station or stations monthly;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the nature of the waste;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the registration mark or marks of the vehicle or vehicles that are to be used for the disposal of waste at the refuse transfer station or stations.

subsection.content: In considering the application, the Director may by notice in writing to the applicant require the applicant to supply to him with such further particulars, information and supporting materials as are reasonably necessary to enable him to determine the application as may be specified in the notice within such time as may be so specified.

section.name: s5A
section.heading: Application for registration as Type A account-holder

subsection.leadIn: Any person (other than a Type B account-holder) may make an application to the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be registered as a Type A account-holder for the purpose of disposing of municipal solid waste at one or more scheduled facilities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to register in the person’s name one or more vehicles (of which the person is the registered owner) to be used for disposing of municipal solid waste at one or more scheduled facilities.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in a way and form specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain the particulars, information and materials the Director reasonably requires for the determination of the application.

subsection.leadIn: Under subsection (2)(b), the Director may, for example, require the applicant to specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the scheduled facility or facilities at which municipal solid waste is intended to be disposed of;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the estimated amount of municipal solid waste that is intended to be disposed of monthly at the scheduled facility or facilities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the nature of the municipal solid waste; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the registration mark or marks of the vehicle or vehicles that is or are to be used for disposing of municipal solid waste at the scheduled facility or facilities.

subsection.content: In considering the application, the Director may, by written notice to the applicant, require the applicant to provide further particulars, information and materials the Director reasonably requires for the determination of the application as specified in the notice within the time specified in the notice.

section.name: s5B
section.heading: Application for registration as Type B account-holder

subsection.content: Any person (other than a Type A account-holder) may make an application to the Director to be registered as a Type B account-holder for the purpose of disposing of municipal solid waste at one or more scheduled facilities.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in a way and form specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain the particulars, information and materials the Director reasonably requires for the determination of the application.

subsection.leadIn: Under subsection (2)(b), the Director may, for example, require the applicant to specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the scheduled facility or facilities at which municipal solid waste is intended to be disposed of;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the estimated amount of municipal solid waste that is intended to be disposed of monthly at the scheduled facility or facilities; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the nature of the municipal solid waste.

subsection.content: In considering the application, the Director may, by written notice to the applicant, require the applicant to provide further particulars, information and materials the Director reasonably requires for the determination of the application as specified in the notice within the time specified in the notice.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Director may register account-holders and vehicles

subsection.content: Where the Director is satisfied that the applicant is a fit and proper person to be registered as a registered account-holder of refuse transfer stations and that the vehicle or vehicles specified in his application are suitable for disposing of waste at refuse transfer stations, he may register the applicant as a registered account-holder at specified refuse transfer stations, and the vehicle or vehicles as registered in his name.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may impose such terms and conditions for registration as he thinks fit including, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, terms and conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requiring the applicant to pay to the Director a deposit of such amount as the Director may specify in the notice under subsection (5) as security for payment of charges and surcharges under this Regulation within such time as may be so specified;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: limiting the registration of that person, or of a vehicle registered in his name, to a particular refuse transfer station.

subsection.content: The Director shall specify the terms and conditions imposed under subsection (2) in the notice under subsection (5) and may from time to time by notice in writing given to the registered account-holder impose, vary or revoke any term or condition.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may refuse to register as a registered account-holder any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to supply the particulars, information and supporting materials in accordance with subsection (2)(b) or (4) of section 5;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: supplies any false particulars, information or supporting materials; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has incurred any charge or surcharge under this Regulation and, as at the date of his application under section 5, has not paid it.

subsection.content: The Director shall, by notice in writing given to the applicant, inform the applicant of his decision to register or refuse to register him as a registered account-holder and shall, in the case of a refusal, state the reasons for refusal.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered account-holder anticipates that the amount of waste that will be disposed of at the refuse transfer station or stations monthly will change substantially compared with the amount he has previously notified to the Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered account holder anticipates that the nature of the waste that will be disposed of at the refuse transfer station or stations will change; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any change in other particulars, information or supporting materials contained in the application for registration occurs,

subsection.continued: he shall as soon as reasonably practicable notify the Director of the change, giving details of the change sufficient for the Director to assess the adequacy of the deposit.

section.name: s6A
section.heading: Director may register Type A account-holders and vehicles

subsection.leadIn: If the Director is satisfied that the applicant making an application under section 5A is a fit and proper person to be registered as a Type A account-holder and that the vehicle or vehicles specified in the application is or are suitable for disposing of municipal solid waste at one or more scheduled facilities, the Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: register the applicant as a Type A account-holder; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: register the vehicle or vehicles in the applicant’s name as a permitted vehicle or permitted vehicles for the facility or facilities.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a vehicle is suitable for disposing of municipal solid waste at a scheduled facility if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is in good working condition;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is constructed in a way that does not—

subparagraph.content: endanger the safety of any person at the facility;
create any nuisance, or any danger to health or the environment, arising from its activity in the facility; or
disrupt the operation of the facility or any collection, removal, transportation, transfer, reception or disposal (including treatment, reprocessing or recycling) of waste in the facility; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the vehicle is equipped with a device described in section 3B of the Waste Disposal (Designated Waste Disposal Facility) Regulation (Cap. 354 sub. leg. L)—it complies with the requirement in subsection (3) of that section.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may impose the terms and conditions for registration as the Director considers appropriate, including terms and conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requiring the applicant to pay to the Director a deposit as security for payment of charges and surcharges under this Regulation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: limiting the registration of the applicant, or of a vehicle in the applicant’s name, to a particular scheduled facility.

subsection.leadIn: The Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must specify the terms and conditions imposed under subsection (3) in the notice under subsection (6); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, from time to time, by written notice to the account-holder, impose, vary or revoke any term or condition.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may refuse to register a person as a Type A account-holder if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person fails to provide the particulars, information or materials under section 5A(2)(b) or (4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person provides any false particulars, information or materials;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the person is a Type B account-holder; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: because of the operation of subsection (2), no vehicle can be registered in the person’s name as a permitted vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must, by written notice to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the applicant of the Director’s decision to register, or refuse to register, the applicant as a Type A account-holder;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Director decides to register the applicant—specify the amount of the deposit mentioned in subsection (3)(a) and the deadline for its payment; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the Director decides to refuse to register the applicant—give the reason for the refusal.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a Type A account-holder anticipates that the nature of the municipal solid waste that the account-holder will dispose of at the scheduled facility or facilities will change; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there is any change in the particulars, information or materials provided by a Type A account-holder under section 5A(2)(b) or (4),

subsection.continued: the account-holder must, as soon as reasonably practicable, notify the Director of the change or anticipated change and give details of the change or anticipated change that are reasonably required by the Director for assessing the adequacy of the deposit mentioned in subsection (3)(a).

section.name: s6B
section.heading: Director may register Type B account-holders

subsection.content: If the Director is satisfied that the applicant making an application under section 5B is a fit and proper person to be registered as a Type B account-holder, the Director may register the applicant as a Type B account-holder.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may impose the terms and conditions for registration as the Director considers appropriate, including terms and conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requiring the applicant to pay to the Director a deposit as security for payment of charges and surcharges under this Regulation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: limiting the registration of the applicant to a particular scheduled facility.

subsection.leadIn: The Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must specify the terms and conditions imposed under subsection (2) in the notice under subsection (5); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, from time to time, by written notice to the account-holder, impose, vary or revoke any term or condition.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may refuse to register a person as a Type B account-holder if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to provide the particulars, information or materials under section 5B(2)(b) or (4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provides any false particulars, information or materials;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: is a Type A account-holder.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must, by written notice to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the applicant of the Director’s decision to register, or refuse to register, the applicant as a Type B account-holder;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Director decides to register the applicant—specify the amount of the deposit mentioned in subsection (2)(a) and the deadline for its payment; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the Director decides to refuse to register the applicant—give the reason for the refusal.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a Type B account-holder anticipates that the nature of the municipal solid waste that the account-holder will dispose of at the scheduled facility or facilities will change; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there is any change in the particulars, information or materials provided by a Type B account-holder under section 5B(2)(b) or (4),

subsection.continued: the account-holder must, as soon as reasonably practicable, notify the Director of the change or anticipated change and give details of the change or anticipated change that are reasonably required by the Director for assessing the adequacy of the deposit mentioned in subsection (2)(a).

subsection.leadIn: A registered account-holder may at any time apply to the Director to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: remove any vehicle registered in his name from registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: register in his name, either in substitution of a vehicle removed from registration under paragraph (a) or as an additional vehicle, a vehicle of which he is the registered owner,

subsection.continued: and sections 5 and 6 shall, subject to necessary modification, apply to an application under paragraph (b).

subsection.content: Where a registered account-holder ceases to be the registered owner of a vehicle already registered in his name under section 6, he shall immediately notify the Director and the registered account-holder remains liable for all charges and surcharges incurred under this Regulation before the Director is so notified for disposal of waste from the vehicle notwithstanding the cessation.

section.name: s7A
section.heading: Registration of additional vehicle etc. for Type A account-holders

subsection.leadIn: A Type A account-holder may at any time make an application to the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to remove any vehicle registered in the account-holder’s name from registration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to register in the account-holder’s name, either in substitution for a vehicle removed from registration under paragraph (a) or as an additional vehicle, a vehicle of which the account-holder is the registered owner as a permitted vehicle.

subsection.content: If an application is made under subsection (1)(b), sections 5A and 6A apply, subject to necessary modifications, in relation to the application.

subsection.leadIn: If a Type A account-holder ceases to be the registered owner of a vehicle already registered in the account-holder’s name under this section or section 6A, the account-holder—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must immediately notify the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: until the Director acknowledges in writing the receipt of the notification, remains liable for all charges and surcharges incurred under this Regulation for the disposal of municipal solid waste from the vehicle.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Register of account-holder
section.content: The Director shall establish and maintain a register in such form and containing such information with respect to persons and vehicles registered under section 6 as he thinks fit.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Recording of weight and time at weighbridge
section.leadIn: A person intending to dispose of waste at a refuse transfer station from a vehicle shall take such reasonable steps as may be necessary for ensuring that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the time when the vehicle enters the in-weighbridge of the refuse transfer station and the gross vehicle weight of the vehicle prior to the disposal is recorded at the in-weighbridge computer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the gross vehicle weight of the vehicle after the disposal is recorded at the out-weighbridge computer.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a registered account-holder shall for each load of waste disposed of at a refuse transfer station from his registered vehicle pay to the Director charges according to the weight of the load.

subsection.leadIn: Where any person disposes of waste at a refuse transfer station from a registered vehicle without complying with section 9, the registered account-holder in whose name the vehicle is registered shall for each load of waste disposed of pay to the Director charges as if the weight of the load of waste disposed of were—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the gross vehicle weight of the vehicle at the in-weighbridge prior to the disposal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if such weight is not recorded, the permitted gross vehicle weight of the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to his liability for an offence under section 18(1), where any person disposes of waste at a refuse transfer station in contravention of section 4, he shall for each load of waste disposed of pay to the Director charges as if the weight of the load of waste disposed of were—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the gross vehicle weight of the vehicle at the in-weighbridge prior to the disposal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if such weight is not recorded, the permitted gross vehicle weight of the vehicle.

subsection.content: The peak hour rate or the non-peak hour rate prescribed in relation to the refuse transfer station concerned in Part 1A of the Schedule shall apply under subsections (1), (2)(a) and (3)(a) depending on whether the vehicle enters the in-weighbridge of the refuse transfer station during peak hours or non-peak hours. (25 of 2021 s. 24)

The peak hour rate prescribed in Part 1A of the Schedule in relation to the refuse transfer station concerned shall apply under subsections (2)(b) and (3)(b) whether or not the vehicle enters the in-weighbridge of the refuse transfer station during peak hour. (25 of 2021 s. 24)

section.name: s11
section.heading: Payment of charges and levy of surcharge

subsection.content: The Director shall from time to time issue to the registered account-holder a notice of demand specifying the amount of the charge payable by the registered account-holder for waste disposed of from his registered vehicles at refuse transfer stations during the period specified in the notice. The amount of the charge shall be payable within 30 days from the date of the notice in such manner as may be specified in the notice.

Where a charge is not paid as required by subsection (1), a surcharge of 5% of the unpaid charge shall become payable and the total amount of the unpaid charge and surcharge shall be paid within 14 days from the date on which the surcharge becomes payable under this subsection.

Where the total amount of unpaid charge and surcharge is not paid as required by subsection (2), the Director may suspend the registration of the registered account-holder and of any vehicle registered in his name, and any vehicle so suspended ceases to be a registered vehicle during the period of suspension.

subsection.leadIn: Upon suspension of the registration of any person as a registered account-holder, the Director shall issue to that person a final notice of demand requiring payment within 14 days of its issue of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all charges and surcharges which have not been paid as required by subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all other unpaid charges incurred in relation to registered vehicles of that person before the suspension.

subsection.content: Where a final notice of demand is settled as required under subsection (4), the Director may, as a condition for restoring the registration of that person, require the registered account-holder to pay such amount as he thinks fit to increase the amount of deposit.

subsection.leadIn: Where the final notice of demand is not settled as required under subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of any charge under subsection (4)(b) which remains unpaid, a surcharge of 5% of such unpaid charge shall become payable; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director may revoke the registration of that person as a registered account-holder.

subsection.leadIn: A deposit paid under section 6—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not bear interest;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not transferable; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may, without prejudice to the exercise of any other power under this Regulation, be applied by the Director at any time to the payment of any charge or surcharge.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (1)(c), the Director shall refund to a person the deposit paid by him if that person ceases to be a registered account-holder—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: upon revocation under section 11(6) or 13; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the request of that person.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may at any time, by notice in writing to a registered account-holder—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: increase the amount of deposit for his continued registration by such amount as may be specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the registered account-holder to pay the increase to the Director within such time and in such manner as may be specified in the notice.

subsection.content: Subsections (1) and (2) apply to any increased amount of deposit paid by any person for his continued registration under this section or for restoring his registration under section 11(5).

subsection.leadIn: A deposit paid by an account-holder under section 6A or 6B—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not bear interest;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not transferable; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may, without prejudice to any other power under this Regulation, be applied by the Director at any time to the payment of any charge or surcharge owed by the account-holder under this Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (1)(c), the Director must refund to a person the deposit or part of the deposit paid by the person if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that the deposit, or that part of the deposit, is no longer required.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may at any time, by written notice to an account-holder—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: increase the amount of deposit for the account-holder’s continued registration by an amount specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the account-holder to pay the increase to the Director within the time and in the way specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (2) apply to any increased amount of deposit paid by any person for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s continued registration as an account-holder; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: restoring the person’s registration under section 11(5).

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 11, the Director may revoke registration of any person as a registered account-holder if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unacceptable waste has been disposed of from a vehicle registered under the name of that person at a refuse transfer station or any person has attempted to dispose of unacceptable waste from such vehicle at such station;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: waste has been disposed of at a refuse transfer station from such vehicle in contravention of section 9 or any person has attempted to dispose of waste at such station from such vehicle in contravention of that section;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any damage has been caused to any refuse transfer station by such vehicle or any person involved with such vehicle has attempted to cause any damage to such station;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where section 11(5) or 12(3) applies, the increased amount of deposit payable for restoring registration of that person or for his continued registration (as the case may be) is not paid as required by that section;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a breach of the service conditions imposed in respect of that person’s registration under section 6 has occurred in relation to that person or his registered vehicle; (25 of 2021 s. 28)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an offence under the Ordinance or this Regulation has been committed by that person or the driver of his registered vehicle or an offence involving the vehicle has been committed under the Ordinance or this Regulation;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the continued registration of that person as a registered account-holder is, in the opinion of the Director, prejudicial to the operation of any refuse transfer station;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: he fails to notify any change in the amount or nature of waste or in other particulars, information or supporting materials as required by section 6(6); or

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: no charge has been incurred in relation to that person under this Regulation for a continuous period of 12 months and he does not, within 28 days of a request by the Director in writing to do so, indicate his desire to maintain the registration.

subsection.content: The Director shall, within 14 days of his decision to do so and by notice in writing, inform the person whose registration is revoked by the Director under section 11 or this section of the fact of, and reason for, the revocation.

section.name: s13A
section.heading: Revocation of registration of Type A account-holder

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 11, the Director may revoke the registration of any person as a Type A account-holder if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unacceptable waste has been disposed of at a scheduled facility from a permitted vehicle registered under section 6A or 7A in the person’s name (relevant vehicle), or any person has attempted to dispose of unacceptable waste at a scheduled facility from a relevant vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: municipal solid waste has been disposed of at a scheduled facility from a relevant vehicle in contravention of section 9, or any person has attempted to dispose of municipal solid waste at a scheduled facility from a relevant vehicle in contravention of that section;

paragraph.name: c
d
e
paragraph.content: a breach of account conditions has occurred in relation to the person or a relevant vehicle;

paragraph.name: f
g
h
paragraph.content: the person fails to comply with section 6A(7); or

no charge has been incurred in relation to the person under this Regulation for a continuous period of 12 months and the person does not, within 28 days from the date of a written request from the Director to do so, indicate the person’s desire to maintain the registration.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: unacceptable waste (不可接受廢物), in relation to a person, means the waste specified as unacceptable waste in the person’s account conditions.

section.name: s13B
section.heading: Revocation of registration of Type B account-holder
section.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 11, the Director may revoke the registration of any person as a Type B account-holder if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a breach of account conditions has occurred in relation to the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person has committed an offence under the Ordinance or this Regulation;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: the person fails to comply with section 6B(6); or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: no charge has been incurred in relation to the person under this Regulation for a continuous period of 12 months and the person does not, within 28 days from the date of a written request from the Director to do so, indicate the person’s desire to maintain the registration.

section.name: s13C
section.heading: Director to give notice of revocation of registration
section.content: If the registration of a person as an account-holder is revoked under section 11(6), 13A or 13B, the Director must give the person written notice of the revocation and the reason for it.

subsection.content: The Director may in writing appoint any public officer, any person employed by a station operator, any contractor (other than a station operator), a facility operator, any non-operator contractor or any person employed by such contractor, to be a designated officer for the purposes of this Regulation. (25 of 2021 s. 30)

A designated officer may collect on behalf of the Director any charge, surcharge or deposit payable to the Director under this Regulation and payment of such charge, surcharge or deposit made to a designated officer on behalf of the Director shall be a sufficient discharge of the obligation in respect of such payment.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: non-operator contractor (非營運承辦商) means a person, other than a facility operator, who has entered into an agreement with the Government or with a facility operator for the carrying out of an activity, or the provision of a service, in connection with the operation or management of a scheduled facility. (25 of 2021 s. 30)

subsection.content: No charge shall be payable under this Regulation in respect of waste collected by or on behalf of the Director of Food and Environmental Hygiene or the Director of Leisure and Cultural Services.

Where any person claims the waste he disposes of or intends to dispose of at a refuse transfer station is, by virtue of subsection (1), not chargeable under this Regulation, the Director may require him to produce such evidence as may be reasonably necessary for establishing that the waste is collected by or on behalf of the Director of Food and Environmental Hygiene or the Director of Leisure and Cultural Services.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Notice, etc. given by the Director

subsection.leadIn: Any notice or other document required or authorized to be given under this Regulation may be given by the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering it personally to the person to whom it is to be given;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by sending it by post to the last known address of the person to whom it is to be given; or (25 of 2021 s. 32)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by sending it by fax transmission or electronic mail to the last known fax number or electronic mail address of the person to whom it is to be given. (25 of 2021 s. 32)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A notice or document given in accordance with subsection (1)(c) is deemed to have been given if a record generated by the means of communication establishes that the notice or document has been sent. (25 of 2021 s. 32)

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsection (1), where a notice is of general application to registered account-holders, the notice may be given by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publishing it in an English language newspaper and a Chinese language newspaper circulating in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: posting it in a conspicuous place at the refuse transfer stations to which the notice relates.

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes section 4 commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

Any person who knowingly or recklessly provides, for the purpose of section 5 (subsection (3)(b) excepted), 5A (other than subsection (3)(b)) or 5B (other than subsection (3)(b)), incorrect or misleading information or knowingly or recklessly certifies for such purpose as correct anything which is incorrect commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (25 of 2021 s. 33)
